info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 5 at 4:06AM EDT until August 5 at 7:00AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg SC
info.description:
* WHAT...Nuisance Flooding caused by heavy rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of upstate South Carolina, including the following counties, Abbeville and Greenwood.
* WHEN...Until 700 AM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas, especially in urban areas. Rapid rises and high flows are expected along area creeks near the Abbeville and Greenwood County line, including Park Creek and Long Cane Creek
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 400 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen since 230 AM. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are likely before the rain tapers off later this morning. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Greenwood, Abbeville, Due West, Donalds, Cokesbury, Hodges, Shoals Junction and Promised Land. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
When it is safe to do so, please report flooding or landslides threatening roads or property to the National Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, by posting on our Facebook page, or via X using hashtag NWSGSP. Your message should describe the specific location where impacts occurred and the depth of flooding observed.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
